edu.ncsu.csc316.grocerystore2.manager

Class GroceryStoreManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc316.grocerystore2.manager.GroceryStoreManager

  • public class GroceryStoreManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The main controller for this software. Handles file IO and printing the list of customers and products.
    Version:
    07262018
    Author:
    John Choi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GroceryStoreManager(java.lang.String pathToProductFile, java.lang.String pathToCustomerFile)
      Constructs a new GroceryStoreManager object using the two input files of customers and products Required method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fileCustomerIO(java.lang.String filename)
      Reads the customer file and adds each customer to the customers list.
      void fileProductIO(java.lang.String filename)
      Handles the product file IO.
      java.lang.String getCustomers()
      Returns the list of customers sorted in ascending order by customer ID as a String in the following format: Customer [id=C0000473, company=Wigmann's, state=DE, zipcode=45272] Customer [id=C0000646, company=Super Food, state=CA, zipcode=22962] Customer [id=C0000679, company=Martino's, state=SD, zipcode=05989] ...
      java.lang.String getProduct(java.lang.String brand, java.lang.String description)
      Returns the product as a String in the following format: Product [brand=Wolf, description=soda, frequency=698] Required method.
      java.lang.String getUnsortedCustomers()
      Returns the list of customers unsorted to start with.
      java.lang.String printProductList()
      Default product list when software starts.
      void sortCustomerByID()
      Sorts the list of customers by their IDs in ascending order.

    • Method Detail

      • getCustomers

        public java.lang.String getCustomers()
        Returns the list of customers sorted in ascending order by customer ID as a String in the following format: Customer [id=C0000473, company=Wigmann's, state=DE, zipcode=45272] Customer [id=C0000646, company=Super Food, state=CA, zipcode=22962] Customer [id=C0000679, company=Martino's, state=SD, zipcode=05989] ... and so on Required method.
        Returns:
        the sorted list of customers

      • getUnsortedCustomers

        public java.lang.String getUnsortedCustomers()
        Returns the list of customers unsorted to start with.
        Returns:
        String unsorted list of customers

      • getProduct

        public java.lang.String getProduct(java.lang.String brand,
                                   java.lang.String description)
        Returns the product as a String in the following format: Product [brand=Wolf, description=soda, frequency=698] Required method.
        Parameters:
        brand - - the brand of the product to lookup
        description - - the description of the product to lookup
        Returns:
        the full product information

      • sortCustomerByID

        public void sortCustomerByID()
        Sorts the list of customers by their IDs in ascending order.

      • printProductList

        public java.lang.String printProductList()
        Default product list when software starts. Gets cleared if user searches for a product.
        Returns:
        String list of products sorted by the frequency
